Vitamin A

Needed for good eyesight, Needed for normal functioning of the immune system
Helps the body process carbohydrates and some protein
Used in many body processes such as converting food into energy,Participates in the metabolism of many drugs, Helps in the production of red blood cells
Aids in digestion, Aids in converting food into energy, Used by the body to help make cholesterol
Helps release energy from carbohydrates and fats and proteins, Helps produce red blood cells
Vital for a healthy nervous system, Helps the body break down proteins, Helps the body break down stored sugar

Utilize amino acids, Produce nucleic acids, Form blood cells in the bone marrow, Ensure rapid cell growth in infancy and adolescence and pregnancy, Control (together with vitamin B6 and vitamin B12) blood levels of the amino acid homocysteine
Needed for creating red blood cells and general cell division
Helps promote a healthy immune system, Is required to help make collagen which holds cells together, Is required for making chemical messengers in the brain
Needed to process calcium and maintain bone health, May have other effects on all cells of the body
Functions as an antioxidant
Helps clot blood, Maintains bone health
Aids in nervous system and muscle function, Helps maintain a healthy balance of water in the blood and body tissues
Balances fluids in the body, Helps send nerve impulses, Needed for muscle contractions
Helps build and maintain strong bones and teeth, Helps muscles function, Involved in cell communication and signaling
Helps cells function normally, Helps the body make energy, Helps red blood cells deliver oxygen, Important in the formation of bone
Helps muscles and nerves function properly, Steadies heart rhythm, Maintains bone strength, Helps the body create energy and make proteins
Vital to many internal processes, Supports immune function and reproduction and the nervous system
Needed to transport oxygen to all parts of the body via the red blood cells
Involved in bone formation and wound healing, Aids in metabolism of proteins and cholesterol and carbohydrates, Acts as an antioxidant
Aids in metabolism of iron and red cell formation, Helps in the production of energy for cells
Cod liver oil, sweet potatoes, carrots, leafy vegetables, fortified foods such as breakfast cereals
Fortified or whole-grain products, bread, pasta, cereals
Milk, breads, fortified cereals, almonds, asparagus, dark meat chicken, cooked beef
Poultry, fish, meat, whole grains, fortified cereals
Broccoli, turnip greens, tomatoes, strawberries, grapefruit, yogurt, yeast, liver, eggs, saltwater fish, whole wheat, peanuts, corn, whole rye flour, legumes
Fortified cereals, fortified soy-based meat substitutes, baked potatoes with skin, bananas, light-meat chicken and turkey, eggs, spinach

Legumes, chickpeas, soybeans, lentils, citrus fruits, wheat bran, fortified cereal, barley, poultry, pork, shellfish, salmon, tuna, milk, asparagus, brocolli, avocados, brussell sprouts, savoy, leafy greens
Beef, clams, mussels, crabs, salmon, poultry, soybeans, fortified foods
Citrus fruits, red berries, tomatoes, potatoes, broccoli, cauliflower, brussels sprouts, red and green bell peppers, cabbage, spinach
Fortified milk, cheese, cereals, egg yolks, sunlight
Leafy green vegetables, almonds, hazelnuts, vegetable oils like sunflower, canola, soybean
Leafy green vegetables like parsley chard and kale, olive canola and soybean oils, broccoli
Broccoli, potatoes (with the skins on), prune juice, orange juice, leafy green vegetables, bananas, raisins, tomatoes
Table salt, baking soda, monosodium glutamate (MSG), various seasonings, additives, condiments, meat, fish, poultry, dairy foods, eggs, smoked meats, olives, pickled foods
Dairy products, broccoli, dark leafy greens like spinach and rhubarb, fortified products such as orange juice, soy milk, tofu
Dairy products, beef, chicken, halibut, salmon, eggs, whole wheat breads
Whole grain products, leafy green vegetables, almonds, Brazil nuts, soybeans, halibut, peanuts, hazelnuts, lima beans, black peas, avocados, bananas, kiwifruit, shrimp
Red meat, fortified cereals, oysters, almonds, peanuts, chickpeas, soy foods, dairy products
Leafy green vegetables, beans, shellfish, red meat, eggs, poultry, soy foods, some fortified foods
Pecans, almonds, legumes, green and black tea, whole grains, pineapple juice
Organ meats, seafood, cashews, sunflower seeds, wheat bran cereals, whole grain products, cocoa products
Night blindness, reduced hair growth in children, loss of apetite, dry and rough skin, lowered resistance to infection, dry eyes
Anxiety, hysteria, depression, muscle cramps, loss of appetite, in extreme cases beriberi (mostly in alcoholics)
Cracks and sores around the mouth and nose, visual problems
Pellagra in extreme cases, characterized by dermatitis diarrhea and mouth sores
Burning sensations in the hands and feet, numbness, poor coordination
Anemia, irritability, patches of itchy scaling skin, convulsions
Impaired cell division, anemia, diarrhea, gastrointestinal upsets
Pernicious anemia, nerve damage, rare except in strict vegetarians or the elderly or people with malabsorption disorders
Muscle weakness, bleeding gums, easy bruising, scurvy in extreme cases
Rickets in children, bone softening in adults, osteoporosis
Seen primarily in premature or low birth weight babies or children who do not absorb fat properly, nerve abnormalities
Defective blood coagulation
Nausea, anorexia, muscle weakness, irritability, Occurs most often in persons with prolonged diarrhea
Hyponatremia, tiredness, disorientation, headache, muscle cramps, nausea
Muscle cramps, Brain function, Rickets in children, osteomalacia (soft bones) and osteoporosis in adults
weakness, bone pain, Anorexia
Nausea, irritability, muscle weakness, twitching, cramps, cardiac arrhythmias
Slow healing of wounds, loss of taste, retarded growth and delayed sexual development in children
Skin pallor, weakness, fatigue, headaches, shortness of breath, difficulty concentrating, brittle nails, cracked lips

Anemia that is unresponsive to iron therapy but corrected by copper, Low WBC’s thus lower immunity, Rare in adults, Infants may develop a type of anemia marked by abnormal development of bones and nerve tissue and lungs
Joint pain, inflammation, arthritis, bursitis, dermatitis, osteoporosis, schizophrenia, diabetes, epilepsy
